channel.title: Breakfast on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Breakfast on Table41NYC

item.title: Upland
item.description: Got eggs in hell, and it was a nice alternative to shakshookas. Somewhat spicy. The price wasn’t too expensive.

item.title: Jack's Wife Freda
item.description: Got the Shakshooka. I also asked for hot sauce, and it was some wet guacamole green looking thing. It has a nice kick to it. The shakshooka was also green too instead of the normal red sauce. Has a good kick to it and was also more sour than usual. Also got a side of the duck bacon which was interesting. Again, skip the lines and sit at the bar.

item.title: Moe's Doughs Donut Shop
item.description: So apparently, the head baker from Peter Pans down the street now works here. Regardless, the ECLAIR with the white filling in the middle is really really good. It’s not too sweet and CHEAP @ $1.50. Better than DKs. Skip the cake donuts of course.

item.title: House of Small Wonder
item.description: This place is cash-only and has Japanese style breakfasts. Think tomato sauce on top of an omelette that has fried rice in it. I got the hamburger steak of course. Decent. Decor is interesting.

item.title: Sunday in Brooklyn
item.description: The Korean looking sammich was good, and so was the biscuits and gravy. Can you tell I’m a biscuits and gravy kinda person? If there’s a line outside, check the bar inside. Might be able to walk in and sit there instead of waiting for a table.

item.title: Buvette
item.description: This place is really good. Their steamed eggs are super fluffy, but pretty expensive. It’s crowded but easy to walk in as 1.

item.title: Egg Shop
item.description: This place sucks, is pricey, and is extremely overrated. I don’t understand why this place has so many people. $18 for a egg on top of salad with fried chicken.

item.title: Doughnut Plant
item.description: Love it! The creme brulee! The cake donuts are whatevers, but the yeast ones are good. I still love Dough more though.

item.title: Russ & Daughters Cafe
item.description: This place was pretty good, but I feel it’s overrated. It has a lot of lox stuff. I didn’t care much for it, but then again I don’t care about lox either.

item.title: Le Barricou
item.description: Came here for brunch. Got the duck hash, and it was pretty good. Service was slower than a snail crawling across the sidewalk.

item.title: Jimmy's Diner
item.description: Their biscuits and gravy with eggs was surprisingly good. Cheap but cash only.

item.title: Reunion
item.description: Their shakshooka is really good! Coffee is good too but definitely get the shakshooka if eating.

item.title: Egg
item.description: I liked it. A little pricey but good stuff.
